content.raw:
My question is where are the debian/ directory for the gazebo packages built ending up at http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gazebo-current/ is located.

None of the control files in this repository generate packages that are named gazebo-current (unless I somehow missed one looking through the branches).

The reason that I need a package named gazebo-current is because the bloom package sources generated are build-dependent on gazebo-current (specifically https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release tag debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring's [control file](https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release/blob/debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring/debian/control))

My question is where are the debian/ directory for the gazebo packages built ending up at http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gazebo-current/ is located.

None of the control files in this repository generate packages that are named gazebo-current (unless I somehow missed one looking through the branches).

The reason that I need a package named gazebo-current is because the bloom package sources generated are build-dependent on gazebo-current (specifically https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release tag debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring's control file)
